Find out how your elected officials voted on civil liberties
  

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

Do your lawmakers fight for what matters to you – strengthening our civil liberties and civil rights? Our scorecard for the 217th legislative session will help you find out.

At a time when so many cherished rights are under threat, New Jersey must be a national leader in furthering our freedom and equality. We tracked state lawmakers' votes on pivotal civil liberties issues in 2016-2017, including ending the abuses of solitary confinement, unjustly punishing boycott participants, and expansion of our state's pioneering family leave insurance program.

Some bills, like guidelines for respecting the rights and dignity of transgender students, are now law. Others, like parole reform, are not.

We need you to hold your lawmakers accountable. The first step is knowing how they voted on these important issues.

No matter who becomes governor in 2018, our elected representatives have the power to improve the lives of all New Jerseyans with their votes and proposals. We hope this scorecard helps you hold them to account for the rest of this legislative session and beyond.

Sincerely,

Amol Sinha
Executive Director
ACLU of New Jersey
